patterns.name: Accordion
patterns.description: An accordion is a vertically stacked set of interactive headings that each contain a title, content snippet, or thumbnail representing a section of content.

patterns.name: Alert
patterns.description: An alert is an element that displays a brief, important message in a way that attracts the user's attention without interrupting the user's task.

patterns.name: Alert Dialog
patterns.description: An alert dialog is a modal dialog that interrupts the user's workflow to communicate an important message and acquire a response.

patterns.name: Breadcrumb
patterns.description: A breadcrumb trail consists of a list of links to the parent pages of the current page in hierarchical order.

patterns.name: Button
patterns.description: A button is a widget that enables users to trigger an action or event, such as submitting a form, opening a dialog, canceling an action, or performing a delete operation.

patterns.name: Carousel
patterns.description: A carousel presents a set of items, such as images or cards, in a rotating sequence.

patterns.name: Checkbox
patterns.description: A checkbox is an input that allows users to choose one or more items from a set, or to turn an option on or off.

patterns.name: Combobox
patterns.description: A combobox is an input widget with an associated popup that enables users to select a value for the combobox from a collection of possible values.

patterns.name: Dialog
patterns.description: A dialog is a window overlaid on either the primary window or another dialog window.

patterns.name: Disclosure
patterns.description: A disclosure is a button that controls the visibility of a section of content.

patterns.name: Feed
patterns.description: A feed is a section of a page that automatically loads new sections of content as the user scrolls.

patterns.name: Grid
patterns.fullName: Grid (Interactive Tabular Data and Layout Containers)
patterns.description: A grid widget is a container that enables users to navigate the information or interactive elements it contains using directional navigation keys.

patterns.name: Landmarks
patterns.description: Landmarks are a way to identify regions of a page, enabling keyboard users to quickly navigate to various sections of a page.

patterns.name: Link
patterns.description: A link widget provides an interactive reference to a resource.

patterns.name: Listbox
patterns.description: A listbox widget presents a list of options and allows a user to select one or more of them.

patterns.name: Menu/Menubar
patterns.description: A menu is a widget that offers a list of choices to the user, such as a set of actions or functions.

patterns.name: Menu Button
patterns.description: A menu button is a button that opens a menu.

patterns.name: Meter
patterns.description: A meter is a graphical display of a numeric value that varies within a defined range.

patterns.name: Radio Group
patterns.description: A radio group is a set of checkable buttons, known as radio buttons, where no more than one of the buttons can be checked at a time.

patterns.name: Slider
patterns.description: A slider is an input where the user selects a value from within a given range.

patterns.name: Multi-Thumb Slider
patterns.description: A multi-thumb slider is a slider with two or more thumbs that each set a value in a group of related values.

patterns.name: Spinbutton
patterns.description: A spinbutton is an input widget that restricts its value to a set or range of discrete values.

patterns.name: Switch
patterns.description: A switch is an input widget that allows users to choose one of two values: on or off.

patterns.name: Table
patterns.description: Like an HTML table element, a WAI-ARIA table is a static tabular structure containing one or more rows that each contain one or more cells; it is not an interactive widget.

patterns.name: Tabs
patterns.description: Tabs are a set of layered sections of content, known as tab panels, that display one panel of content at a time.

patterns.name: Toolbar
patterns.description: A toolbar is a container for grouping a set of controls, such as buttons, menubuttons, or checkboxes.

patterns.name: Tooltip
patterns.description: A tooltip is a popup that displays information related to an element when the element receives keyboard focus or the mouse hovers over it.

patterns.name: Tree View
patterns.description: A tree view widget presents a hierarchical list.

patterns.name: Treegrid
patterns.description: A treegrid widget presents a hierarchical data grid consisting of tabular information that is editable or interactive.

patterns.name: Window Splitter
patterns.description: A window splitter is a moveable separator between two sections, or panes, of a window that enables users to change the relative size of the panes.
